properties.areaDesc: Sangamon, IL; Menard, IL; Mason, IL; Cass, IL
properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 10 at 10:24AM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
This hydrologic outlook includes the following river in Illinois:

Sangamon River...

The following river information is based on future predicted
rainfall. The exact amount, intensity, timing, and location of the
rain that will occur is still uncertain. These outlook stages are
provided to show what may be expected if the forecast precipitation
occurs. Once there is more certainty about the river forecasts, a
flood warning or statement will be issued if the threat materializes.

For the Sangamon River at Riverton...the latest stage is 7.1 feet at
10 AM Friday. Flood stage is 23.0 feet. Minor flooding is forecast...
with a crest of 23.0 feet early Thursday morning...which is equal to
the flood stage. The river should rise above the flood stage of 23.0
feet early Thursday morning. The river should fall below flood stage
Thursday afternoon.

For the Sangamon River at Petersburg...the latest stage is 6.8 feet
at 9 AM Friday. Flood stage is 23.0 feet. Minor flooding is
forecast...with a crest of 23.0 feet Thursday evening...which is
equal to the flood stage. The river should rise above the flood stage
of 23.0 feet Thursday evening. At 23.0 feet...Extensive agricultural
and lowland flooding occurs.

For the Sangamon River near Oakford...the latest stage is 458.5 feet
at 10 AM Friday. Flood stage is 471.0 feet. Minor flooding is
forecast...with a crest of 472.0 feet Tuesday morning...which is 1.0
feet above flood stage. The river should rise above the flood stage
of 471.0 feet early Monday morning. At 471.0 feet...Flooding begins
to agricultural areas not protected by levees.

For the Sangamon River near Chandlerville...the latest stage is 445.9
feet at 10 AM Friday. Flood stage is 456.6 feet. Moderate flooding is
forecast...with a crest of 459.0 feet Tuesday afternoon...which is
2.4 feet above flood stage. The river should rise above the flood
stage of 456.6 feet Sunday evening. At 459.9 feet...Flooding begins
to impact some residences in Chandlerville.
